sub_title: Circular Economy Lecturer & Coach at HAN University of Applied Sciences
summary:
My ambition is to make a valuable contribution with my corporate, media and not-for-profit experience to enhance a sustainable economy and society while taking care of our environment. I believe sustainable development is a key driver for innovation and growth and sustainability should, and can, be embedded in the core of each business or organisation. While connecting people and managing change in a holistic way I tackle challenges purposefully and solution oriented. 

As an impact oriented person I question the status quo to make more conscious decisions.I differentiate myself by the way I place myself in one’s perspective, my optimism and curiosity, the natural ability to work together with different key groups, and the balancing of empathy and my result driven business mindset. 

I have contributed to different (sustainable-) business innovation projects. My most inspiring assignments include the analysis on sustainable business models for natural capital at Rijkswaterstaat. And my project management for IKEA Portugal and Spain, where I learned to initiate and implement projects into different contexts and drive a behavioural change. As a leader I gained experience from my time as sales manager for IKEA in Russia empowering my team and driving results.

Through my professional and voluntary experiences I came to develop skills and competencies such as a helicopter view (strategic thinking), leadership, analytical approach, negotiation, storytelling and presenting, stress resistance, critical thinking and consensus seeking.  

Fields of interest/experience: corporate social responsibility (CSR), programme & project management, sustainability assessment, strategy and visioning, sustainable business strategies, social entrepreneurship, sustainable urban mobility plans (SUMP), feasibility studies, biobased economy, natural capital analyses (e.g. sustainable business canvas, ecosystem services)

Please feel free to contact me via liard.kranen@gmail.com

education.degree_name: Master Sustainability Science and Policy MSc SSP

awards.title: Winner of Battle of Concepts  Sustainability Challenge
awards.description:
- The Dutch Ministry of Infrastructure and Environment wants to take the lead and become a ‘frontrunner in sustainability’ 
- My  concept of a dashboard based on the SDG’s to measure the baseline situation and to  
  sustainability effects of their actions won the 4th  place  out of 50 concepts
awards.issuer: Dutch Ministry of Infrastructure and the Environment

awards.title: Winner of the European Commission European Transport  Innovation Challenge
awards.description:
- One of the 12 winners from over 110 innovative solutions for decarbonising EU transport 
- Introduced concept of underground pipelines for last mile urban deliveries  see the EC website:  
  http://bit.ly/2t4m1V1 
- Presented and pitched the solution at the Intelligent Transport Systems congress in Strasbourg
awards.issuer: European Commission / Department for Mobility and Transport (DG MOVE)

awards.title: Winner of the Circular Economy Waste Innovation Challenge
awards.description:
- The largest national waste management association of the Netherlands initiated a challenge to find 
  solutions for fly tipping at recycling points/ eco-islands 
- At the NVDR congress I presented my solution combining a different approach to Communication, 
 Behavioural change (Green Agents to support co-ownership and improve social involvement) and  
 most radical the Design (using the space of the grey containers itself to inspire & convince people  
 and to make those areas part of the neighbourhood) which won the vote of the 250+ audience
awards.issuer: NVRD (Dutch national waste management association) & Maastricht University Institute of Education Innovation

projects.title: CIVITAS training on evaluation and upscaling of urban mobility projects
projects.description:
In order to achieve urban sustainability goals many projects and pilots are implemented. Piloting offers a good and structured approach for learning about new concepts and technical innovations.Though many of the pilots result in success, it is often a challenge to upscaling the results into broader implementation and large scale deployment. Upscaling results is vital to actually achieve the goals cities are aiming for.

The training covered the following elements:
Common drivers and barriers of implementing mobility projects
Long term effects of mobility projects
Developing a business model for your project results

contributors.headline: Circular Economy Lecturer & Coach at HAN University of Applied Sciences

projects.title: Participant in the CIVITAS FORUM 2016 - SHAPING THE MOBILITY OF TOMORROW - Gdynia Poland
projects.description:
The event gathered 550 CIVITAS stakeholders from around Europe, all devoted to the development of sustainable urban mobility in cities.The three-day conference offered collaborative workshops, presentations and site visits.

Amongst others I participated in these sessions:
- Travel behaviour change: an overview on promotion campaign, incentives and  target groups
- Achievements in Sustainable Urban Mobility Planning in Europe
- Participation: involving citizens, stakeholders and experts
- Workshop: Shaping cycling in the EU

projects.title: International Summer School `Sustainable Mobility – Made in Leipzig'
projects.description:
Organised by the Institute of Transport Planning and Road Traﬃc of the Technische Universität Dresden together with the City of Leipzig.

The Summer School covered the following subjects:
   - Sustainable mobility planning in urban areas
   - Environmental and social challenges in transport
   - Visions for urban and road design
   - Pedestrian planning
   - Bicycle planning
   - Public consultation
   - Electric mobility
   - Mobility surveys and transportation data

projects.title: Mapping potential sustainable business models for capitalizing Eco Systems services (Biobased economy) in the Noordwaard area
projects.description:
A sustainability assessment of Biobased economy management options for the Noordwaard area, including:
1.	Scan of the ecosystem services in the area 
2.	Scan of potential users in the area 
3.	Explore potential business models using promising ecosystem services

Partners; Deltares, Rijkswaterstaat.

projects.title: Participant of the National Sustainability Challenge 2015
projects.description: Solving sustainability issues for enterprises.With my team I worked on Prorails's case. Prorail asked us to come up with innovative ideas for train station lighting.On the crossing point of responsibilities for the municipality (outside of the train station)  and Prorail (as responsible for the train station itself). Prorail also wanted to save costs and decrease the environmental impact of 'light pollution'.Our solution combined smart ways of a cradle to cradle usage of existing infrastructure combined with new ways of lighting such as fluorescent paint.Combined with a collaboration with Philips Lighting Solutions to have a radically different approach by using light as a service and creating a partnership rather then a transaction.

contributors.headline: Circular Economy Lecturer & Coach at HAN University of Applied Sciences

profile_positions.description: As lecturer sharing insights/theory/tools on our perspective of a broad circular economy (meervoudige waardecreatie) & as coach working with students and companies/organisations on real everyday challenges in the transformation towards a Circular Economy within the HAN Master Circular Economy innovation lab.
profile_positions.title: Circular Economy Lecturer & Coach

profile_positions.description:
As a member of the Global INGKA Group Sustainability team and in the role of Sustainability Risk & Verification Reviewer for Austria, Switzerland and Germany  I contributed to the positioning of the IKEA brand as a unique, meaningful, trusted brand through our approach in defining, implementing, and verifying sustainability goals and requirements. 

Improving the lives of the many people and the IKEA business by identifying opportunities and adequately mitigating risks to improve the level of compliance and efficiency of our suppliers. Developing them and ourselves on the way to become a circular business by the year 2030.
profile_positions.title: Sustainability Risk & Verification Reviewer

profile_positions.description:
ICLEI is the world´s leading network of 12 mega-cities, 100 super-cities and urban regions, 450 large cities, and 450 small and medium-sized cities and towns in 84 countries committed​ to building​ a sustainable future. By helping the ICLEI Network to become sustainable,​ low-carbon, ecomobile, resilient, biodiverse, resource-efficient, healthy and happy, with a green economy and smart infrastructure, we impact over 25% of the global urban population.

The Governance & Social Innovation team develops, coordinates and implements projects and services focused on societal and governance aspects of sustainable development in European cities. 

I supported local governments in developing innovative, integrated and participatory management and planning systems. Our team explores issues such as demographic change, social inclusion and new forms of self-organisation in civil society. Activities range from involvement in global advocacy and European projects to services for national and regional governments and individual cities.

At ICLEI I gained experience in the conceptualisation of guidance materials such as case studies, drafting of reports (e.g. policy briefs), dissemination of information on projects and more generally on issues of Governance and Social Innovation, writing of news articles, the exploitation (business models) of EU projects, I contributed to the acquisition of future projects and writing of project proposals (e.g. H2020), collaboration in the development and delivery of services for local governments (sustainable innovation focused)  in the area of Governance and Social Innovation and the Circular Economy.
